headline: Joe Rogan Says Warren Buffett, George Soros Are 'Not As Good As' Nancy Pelosi's Husband In Stock Trading, Thinks Politicians 'Know Something'
summary: Comedian Joe Rogan says U.S. politicians profit from insider knowledge when trading stocks. He was discussing the stock trading activities of politicians with political commentators Krystal Ball and Saagar Enjeti. headline: OpenAI Funding on Track to Top $100 Billion in Latest Round
summary: As the ChatGPT maker prepares to spend trillions in infrastructure investment, the overall valuation of the company, including the eventual funding, could exceed $850 billion, according to some of the people.  The company’s pre-money value will remain $730 billion, said one person, all of whom asked not to be identified discussing private information.  The first portion of the funding round will largely come from strategic investors including Amazon.com Inc., SoftBank Group Corp., Nvidia Corp. and Microsoft Corp., the people said.

content.title: OpenAI Funding on Track to Top $100 Billion in Latest Round
content.summary: As the ChatGPT maker prepares to spend trillions in infrastructure investment, the overall valuation of the company, including the eventual funding, could exceed $850 billion, according to some of the people.  The company’s pre-money value will remain $730 billion, said one person, all of whom asked not to be identified discussing private information.  The first portion of the funding round will largely come from strategic investors including Amazon.com Inc., SoftBank Group Corp., Nvidia Corp. and Microsoft Corp., the people said.

headline: India's Tata signs up OpenAI as customer for data centre business
summary: OpenAI will become the first customer of India's ‌Tata Consultancy Services' data centre business, ‌beginning with 100 megawatts of capacity, part of the ​global AI infrastructure initiative Stargate, the companies said.  Stargate is a $500 billion multi-year initiative to build AI data centres for training and inference, ‌backed by major ⁠investors.  The deal is a major boost for TCS, which in a ⁠strategic shift last year disclosed plans to invest up to $7 billion in a 1 gigawatt ​data centre ​unit in India.

content.title: India's Tata signs up OpenAI as customer for data centre business
content.summary: OpenAI will become the first customer of India's ‌Tata Consultancy Services' data centre business, ‌beginning with 100 megawatts of capacity, part of the ​global AI infrastructure initiative Stargate, the companies said.  Stargate is a $500 billion multi-year initiative to build AI data centres for training and inference, ‌backed by major ⁠investors.  The deal is a major boost for TCS, which in a ⁠strategic shift last year disclosed plans to invest up to $7 billion in a 1 gigawatt ​data centre ​unit in India.

headline: How hyperscalers like Oracle and Meta are driving the AI arms race
summary: Listen and subscribe to Stocks In Translation on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcast. The AI boom is here, but a few hyperscalers are running the show.In this episode of Stocks in Translation, BNP Paribas Equity Research Equity Analyst David O’Connor joins host Jared Blikre and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma to discuss the AI trade and the outsized influence of hyperscalers. They break down how a handful of giant buyers, including Amazon (AMZN), Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOGL) (GOOG), Meta (META), and Oracle (ORCL), are driving AI infrastructure spending, shaping the semiconductor market, and setting the pace for the next wave of AI growth and innovation.Twice a week, Stocks In Translation cuts through the market mayhem, noisy numbers and hyperbole to give you the information you need to make the right trade for your portfolio. You can find more episodes here, or watch on your favorite streaming service. This post was written by Lauren Pokedoff

content.title: How hyperscalers like Oracle and Meta are driving the AI arms race
content.description:
Listen and subscribe to Stocks In Translation on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcast.

The AI boom is here, but a few hyperscalers are running the show.

In this episode of Stocks in Translation, BNP Paribas Equity Research Equity Analyst David O’Connor joins host Jared Blikre and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma to discuss the AI trade and the outsized influence of hyperscalers. They break down how a handful of giant buyers, including Amazon (AMZN), Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOGL) (GOOG), Meta (META), and Oracle (ORCL), are driving AI infrastructure spending, shaping the semiconductor market, and setting the pace for the next wave of AI growth and innovation.

Twice a week, Stocks In Translation cuts through the market mayhem, noisy numbers and hyperbole to give you the information you need to make the right trade for your portfolio. You can find more episodes here, or watch on your favorite streaming service.

This post was written by Lauren Pokedoff

They break down how a handful of giant buyers, including Amazon (AMZN), Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOGL) (GOOG), Meta (META), and Oracle (ORCL), are driving AI infrastructure spending, shaping the semiconductor market, and setting the pace for the next wave of AI growth and innovation.Twice a week, Stocks In Translation cuts through the market mayhem, noisy numbers and hyperbole to give you the information you need to make the right trade for your portfolio. headline: Traders Left With ‘Unscratchable Itch’ for Anthropic Exposure
summary: For nearly a month investors have raced to dump shares of companies that could be disrupted by AI tools like Anthropic’s Claude Cowork.  Sharp selling has been seen by a wide variety of sectors including software, legal services, wealth management and transportation logistics on worries that the tools could erode growth, demand and pricing power at traditional companies.  This absence of a publicly traded companies that offer some kind of exposure or correlation to Anthropic is becoming a frustration for traders, who are instead stuck trying to side-step the growing a list of stocks that have plunged because of its tools.

content.title: Traders Left With ‘Unscratchable Itch’ for Anthropic Exposure
content.summary: For nearly a month investors have raced to dump shares of companies that could be disrupted by AI tools like Anthropic’s Claude Cowork.  Sharp selling has been seen by a wide variety of sectors including software, legal services, wealth management and transportation logistics on worries that the tools could erode growth, demand and pricing power at traditional companies.  This absence of a publicly traded companies that offer some kind of exposure or correlation to Anthropic is becoming a frustration for traders, who are instead stuck trying to side-step the growing a list of stocks that have plunged because of its tools.

headline: Amazon's annual sales overtake Walmart for the first time ever
summary: Amazon's (AMZN) annual sales surpassed those of big box retailer Walmart (WMT) in 2025. The e-commerce giant posted $717 billion in revenue compared to Walmart's $713.2 billion this past fiscal year. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma weighs in on the sales figures released by these companies.  To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Amazon Stock Is Slumping. But The Tech Giant Just Dethroned Walmart For This Milestone.
summary: Amazon has officially dethroned Walmart as the world's largest company by revenue.  Walmart's fiscal Q4 results on Thursday showed Amazon pulling ahead in 12-month revenue for the first time, a milestone forecasted by Amazon stock analysts coming into 2025.  Walmart on Thursday reported annual sales of $713.2 billion for the 12 months ending Jan. 31, compared to Amazon's $716.9 billion in sales for the 12-months ended Dec. 31.

content.title: Amazon Stock Is Slumping. But The Tech Giant Just Dethroned Walmart For This Milestone.
content.summary: Amazon has officially dethroned Walmart as the world's largest company by revenue.  Walmart's fiscal Q4 results on Thursday showed Amazon pulling ahead in 12-month revenue for the first time, a milestone forecasted by Amazon stock analysts coming into 2025.  Walmart on Thursday reported annual sales of $713.2 billion for the 12 months ending Jan. 31, compared to Amazon's $716.9 billion in sales for the 12-months ended Dec. 31.

headline: Etsy shares jump after Depop sale; demand pressures weigh on results
summary: The nearly $1.2 billion deal, ​announced after markets closed on Wednesday, is expected to help Etsy focus on its core business as it pushes a turnaround under its new CEO, while grappling with inflation-hit shoppers and strong competition ‌from e-commerce heavyweights such ⁠as Amazon.com.  Etsy had sold its online music gear marketplace Reverb to private investors in 2025.  The sale of Depop, which Etsy acquired in ​2021 for $1.63 ​billion, is expected to close ​in the second quarter of ‌2026.

content.title: Etsy shares jump after Depop sale; demand pressures weigh on results
content.summary: The nearly $1.2 billion deal, ​announced after markets closed on Wednesday, is expected to help Etsy focus on its core business as it pushes a turnaround under its new CEO, while grappling with inflation-hit shoppers and strong competition ‌from e-commerce heavyweights such ⁠as Amazon.com.  Etsy had sold its online music gear marketplace Reverb to private investors in 2025.  The sale of Depop, which Etsy acquired in ​2021 for $1.63 ​billion, is expected to close ​in the second quarter of ‌2026.

headline: Square Expands Partner Ecosystem in 2026, Empowering Sellers With Connected Tools, Insights, and Expertise to Accelerate Growth
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, February 19, 2026--Square today announced that it is expanding its partner ecosystem in 2026, further solidifying its standing as the provider of choice for sellers and partners alike. With key partners including Amazon, Apple, Intuit QuickBooks, and Uber Eats choosing Square, the company is reinforcing its commitment to providing sellers with the best-in-class tools needed to succeed. headline: Should You Buy, Hold or Sell TTD Stock Ahead of Q4 Earnings?
summary: The Trade Desk heads into Q4 earnings with CTV and retail media momentum, but macro pressures and fierce competition cloud the near-term outlook.

content.title: Should You Buy, Hold or Sell TTD Stock Ahead of Q4 Earnings?

headline: Remitly hires Santander alum as its next CEO
summary: Sebastian Gunningham served as vice chair of Santander’s Openbank platform. He replaces Remitly co-founder Matt Oppenheimer, who will move into a board chair role.

content.title: Remitly hires Santander alum as its next CEO
